<title level="1" pfs="">[Necromancer](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3538)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Defiling the natural order and spitting in the face of convention, the necromancer remains dutifully committed to understanding what forces await beyond the mortal boundaries of life and death.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 20

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 18

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 15
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Necromancer.webp" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 5">[Necromancer](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3538)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Human" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=627" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=628" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 99

**Perception** +10

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20)

**Skills**
[Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=35) +11, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +8, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44) +13

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +2

**Dex** +3

**Con** +2

**Int** +4

**Wis** +2

**Cha** -1
</row>

**Stench of Decay** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=662), [olfactory](/Traits.aspx?ID=664)) The necromancer emits a scent of putrid rot in a 5-foot emanation. A living creature that enters or begins its turn in the aura is [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91).

**Items**
hooded robe, [Light Mace](/Weapons.aspx?ID=5)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 20 

**Fort** +11 

**Ref** +12 

**Will** +11 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 65

</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
light mace +14 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Shove](/Traits.aspx?ID=193)),
**Damage** 1d4+8 bludgeoning

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
fist +14 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)),
**Damage** 1d4+8 bludgeoning

**Occult Innate Spells** DC 23
- **Cantrips (3rd)**
[Void Warp](/Spells.aspx?ID=1745)

**Undead, Arise!** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) The necromancer summons two Medium undead entities in different empty squares up to 30 feet away. These undead entities can take the form of zombies, skeletons, or ghosts, chosen by the necromancer. The entities block movement as though they were creatures and can be attacked. Each entity has 1 Hit Point and the same AC and saves as the necromancer. They can't take actions of their own and deteriorate if the necromancer is reduced to 0 Hit Points. The necromancer can have up to four undead entities at any given time. If they call another, the oldest undead entity deteriorates.

**Undead, Attack!** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) **Requirements** The necromancer has at least one undead entity active; **Effect** The necromancer commands all their undead entities to attack. Each entity can Stride up to 20 feet into an empty square and make a Strike. The Strike has a +15 attack modifier and deals 2d12 bludgeoning damage (or spirit damage if the entity is a spirit). The Strike has the [magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=644) trait, and no multiple attack penalty applies to it.

**Wave of Death** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), [Void](/Traits.aspx?ID=510)) **Requirements** The necromancer isn't [drained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=68) and has at least one undead entity active; **Effect** The necromancer overloads their undead entities with void energy, causing all of them to explode. Each entity is destroyed, dealing 4d12 void damage to each creature in a 10-foot emanation with a DC 23 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save. A creature in more than one explosion is damaged only once. The necromancer becomes drained 1.

</column>
